Description: Fragment of neck and shoulder join of Milesian Fikellura pottery amphora or oinochoe; glaze fired red-brown; exterior: cream slip; plastic ridge at junction, glazed; below, part of ivy leaf pattern with one (accidental?) dot; at right, part of glazed handle zone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes (1992, 208, N23): "Milesian(?), Fikellura Ware or related (as N22). For a similar scheme see CVA Oxford2 II D, pl. VI.3 and the amphora from Miletos, von Graeve (1974) 107 and pl. 30 no.117. Discussion of motif: R.M. Cook BSA 34 (1933-34) 74.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 208, no. N23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.098)
